Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with part of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (part of hindquarters with added red dot on haunch and body with trace of mane), to right; below on cul, tongue pattern around handle root (now lost) and part of double guilloche pattern.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 484)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0504) (phase 2)
